content:
There are several incentives and rewards available for citizens and organizations in Nagpur that promote clean air and sustainable practices:

1. Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) provides a 50% concession on property tax for buildings that install solar energy systems.

2. Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) provides a subsidy of up to 50% for setting up biogas plants, waste-to-energy plants, and sewage treatment plants.

3. The Government of India’s Ministry of New and Renewable Energy offers a subsidy of up to 30% for installing solar panels and other renewable energy systems.

4. The NMC provides free saplings for citizens to plant in their vicinity.

5. The NMC also provides a financial incentive of Rs. 1 lakh to housing societies, educational institutions, and commercial establishments that install rainwater harvesting systems.

6. The NMC conducts cleanliness drives and awards cash prizes to citizens and organizations that contribute to the initiative.

7. The NMC also has a Swachh Nagpur campaign under which it recognizes individuals and organizations that take up initiatives to keep the city clean and sustainable.

These incentives and rewards encourage citizens and organizations to adopt sustainable practices and contribute to making Nagpur a cleaner and more environment-friendly city.
